intro: Aethionema rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leafed rock白菜, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, rounded leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
